intro: Serratula nudicaulis subsp. transcaucasica, commonly known as the Transcaucasian nipplewort, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its small, green, hairy leaves and yellow flowers arranged in a composite head. Native to the Caucasus region, this subspecies thrives in rocky and arid environments. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and is often found in mountainous areas. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Serratula genus, with specific adaptations to its harsh native habitat.
